content.description: To the left of Dry County (11d) is this old head point slab climb which will require a bit more traffic to really clean it off.  Excellent but tricky movement off of the ledge with another crux below the last bolt before the anchors.
content.protection: In the original Fixed Pin Arkansas Guide by Cole Fennel this route has an X rating.  However, it has been very recently bolted and is now a very safe climb.
content.location: To the left of Dry County (11d) and Poison Ivy (7+).

content.description: Stem and chimney up, taking care no to go too deep into the chimney. Crux comes toward the beginning before the chimney is narrow enough to sit and scooch your way to the top.
content.location: Though not technically on Poison Ivy wall, this lone route is only about 25 yards to the east of Poison Ivy deep in a slot.

content.description: Climb the ever steepening dihedral crack as it slims from hands/fists to thin hands and fingers.  Classic route on excellent rock.
content.protection: Gear to 3 or 3.5".  I think there are bolts now as an anchor.  If not, rap down trees or walk over to the walkdown near the Patio Wall.
content.location: This is the very apparent dihedral crack.

content.description: Obvious left angling hand crack becomes offwidth.    Then it gets better until another crux.
Unique mixed route that climbs a seemingly blank face. Bring a #2 camalot for the middle section and prepare for some wizardry ahead. Crux lies at the very end.
content.protection: a few small pieces of pro or just run it out to the bolts.  This route has anchors.

content.description: This is the steep slab and corner system just right of the trail split.
